titleStmt.title: A Warning for married women by the example of Mrs. Jane Renalds a West-country woman ... who having plighted her troth to a seaman was afterwards married to a carpenter and at last carried away by a spirit, the manner how shall be presently recited : to a gallant West-country tune cal'd The fair maid of Bristol, or, Bateman, or, John True.

A Warning for married women by the example of Mrs. Jane Renalds a West-country woman ... who having plighted her troth to a seaman was afterwards married to a carpenter and at last carried away by a spirit, the manner how shall be presently recited : to a gallant West-country tune cal'd The fair maid of Bristol, or, Bateman, or, John True.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Coles and W. Gilbertson,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Glasgow University Library.
